    • Constructor Detail

      • Buyable

        public Buyable(java.lang.String theName,
               int theCost,
               int thePunishment,
               int loc,
               java.lang.String[] sprite)
        Buyable's constructor. Takes in more information than Square - each Buyable has its own cost to buy it and starting rent. Other variables, like mortgageValue, are directly tied to the cost.

    • Method Detail

      • auction

        public void auction()
        If a player lands on a property but chooses not to buy it, it will go to auction. All players will have a chance at purchasing the property.

      • doItsThing

        public void doItsThing()
        When you land on a Buyable, one of 3 things may happen. If it is unowned, you may buy it or put it to auction. If it's owned by you, nothing happens. If it's owned by someone else, you are punish()ed - you pay them rent. The method of this is specific to the subclasses.
        Specified by:
        doItsThing in class Square

      • getBuyBackVal

        public int getBuyBackVal()

      • getCost

        public int getCost()

      • getMortgage

        public boolean getMortgage()

      • getOwner

        public int getOwner()
        "Getter" methods for Buyable's instance variables.

      • mortgage

        public boolean mortgage(int pNum)
        Deposits some money in the mortgaging player (pNum)'s account, and then sets the property to mortgaged. Also changes some information about the Sprite of the square for a visual representation of it being mortgaged in the UI.

      • punish

        public abstract void punish()
        Punishes players for landing on spaces owned by other players. Implemented seperately in the 3 subclasses of Buyable

      • sell

        public void sell(int playerNum)
        Responsible for selling the property to a player, if they so desire. If they don't, it'll go to auction. playerNum -- refers to the player who the buyable is being sold to cost -- refers to the amount of $$ the buying player must have buyNum -- refers to the location of the buyable on the 'board'

      • unmortgage

        public void unmortgage()
        An OVERLOADED version of unmortgage, for use when a mortgaged property has gone to the bank, its status needs to be flipped. The bank has no balance, so no withdraw method is necessary.

      • unmortgage

        public void unmortgage(int pNum)
        Exact reverse of the above mortgage method. Unmortgages the property, withdraws some money from the player's account, and changes some UI info.
